macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Markets End Week Lower with Major Indexes Posting Small Declines
items.summary: The S&P 500 fell 0.4%, Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 0.5%, Nasdaq Composite declined 0.1%, Russell 2000 lost 0.3%, and S&P MidCap 400 shed 0.6% as of Friday's close on January 24, 2026. Markets showed volatility with defensive sectors like energy and materials outperforming amid elevated yields and uncertainty.

items.title: Weekly Market Recap Highlights Sector Rotation and Volatility Spike
items.summary: Friday saw sharp intraday swings with VIX jumping nearly 30%, tech and mega-caps leading downside, while energy, materials, and defensives held up; earlier relief came from Trump comments delaying February tariffs and steady inflation data.

items.title: STL.News Reports US Markets Pause Amid Defensive Shift and Sector Hesitation
items.summary: All major US indexes closed the week modestly lower, with Dow underperforming due to financial and industrial weakness; Nasdaq outperformed on select tech gains, but investors rotated to defensives amid rate policy uncertainty.

items.title: Natural Gas Futures Surge 62.6% in Record Three-Day Gain to $5.05
items.summary: Front-month Nymex natural gas prices rocketed higher, catching speculators off guard after heavy net short positions; energy sector strength noted in broader market recaps.

items.title: Russell 2000 Small Caps Outperform S&P 500 for 14 Straight Sessions
items.summary: Small-cap Russell 2000 has beaten S&P 500 for longest streak since 1996, hitting seven record highs in 2026 amid value and cyclical rotation; contrasts with large-cap tech volatility.

items.title: Japanese 40-Year Bond Yields Spike Above 4% in Historic Jump
items.summary: Yields crossed 4% for first time with 29.7 basis point surge, largest one-day move since April, signaling global bond market turbulence.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: XRP Falls 4.29% Weekly Amid Crypto Bill Delays and ETF Outflows
items.summary: XRP declined 4.29% for the week ending January 25 as US Senate committees delayed progress on the Market Structure Bill. The token closed at $1.9136 on January 24, down from a January 6 high of $2.4151, reflecting investor sensitivity to regulatory developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Drops Below $89,000 USDT
items.summary: Bitcoin fell below the $89,000 level, trading at $88,974.83 USDT on January 25 at 03:30 AM UTC, representing a 1.04% decline.

items.title: Ethereum Mainnet Activity Surges but Shows Signs of Artificial Inflation
items.summary: Ethereum's daily active addresses approached 1 million in January and briefly reached 1.3 million on January 16, driven by lower transaction fees. However, security researchers warn that address poisoning attacks are inflating the data, with attackers sending tiny stablecoin amounts to create fake addresses.

items.title: South Korea Prepares Major Cryptocurrency Regulation Overhaul
items.summary: South Korea's Financial Intelligence Unit is forming a task force to modernize anti-money-laundering rules for crypto, with a policy proposal expected by mid-2026. The changes would require sender and recipient information for all transfers, eliminating the current $700 threshold.

items.title: Davos 2026 Highlights Crypto's Geopolitical Significance
items.summary: The World Economic Forum's Davos 2026 event featured significant discussions on cryptocurrency within broader geopolitical and political contexts, demonstrating crypto's growing importance in global affairs.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: 20+ Games Coming to Xbox Next Week (January 26-30)
items.summary: Xbox is releasing over 20 games in the coming week, including five new Xbox Game Pass titles. Notable releases include Code Vein 2 and free-to-play shooter Highguard.

items.title: Xbox Exec Explains Day-One PS5 Release Strategy
items.summary: An Xbox executive discussed why some first-party games launch simultaneously on PS5 while others don't, citing development realities and team size. Fable is confirmed for day-one PS5 release, while Forza Horizon 6 won't arrive on PlayStation until later in 2026.

items.title: Undertale Available at 75% Discount on Steam
items.summary: The highly-rated indie game Undertale is currently discounted to $2.49 on Steam, representing a 75% reduction from its regular price.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
